title: As a BOC user I want to view the System Forms widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN  a BOC user is logged in with System Forms Widget permissions 
AND user navigated to the "Reporting" dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Blank Forms" tab
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the System Forms widget. 
AND The widget should follow the provided data discovery and wireframe.

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=system_forms_-_boc

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+System+Forms+widget

title: As a BOC user I want to add a new Language to the system forms widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in with system forms widget edit permission
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the System Forms widget
custom_expected:
THEN system allows the user to select "Language" 
AND If they click "Language" the system opens up a pop-up, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The user has the ability to select a new Language from the provided list of Languages. 
AND Once a value is entered, the "Save" button becomes enabled. 
AND The "Cancel" button is always enabled. 
AND Clicking Cancel will close the modal and no new form type is stored.
AND Clicking Save will store the new Language.
AND The new Language will be available for use when creating new and editing existing system forms.
AND The next time the user goes to enter a new Language, this one will no longer be available (cannot add the same language multiple times).

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=new_language

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89350246

title: As a BOC user I want to add a new Form Type to the system forms widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in with create/Edit permission on System Forms widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the System Forms widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will allow the user to select "Form Type" 
AND If they click "Form Type" the system opens up a pop-up, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The user has the ability to enter text and special characters here. 
AND Once a value is entered, the "Save" button becomes enabled. 
AND The "Cancel" button is always enabled. 
AND Clicking Cancel will close the modal and no new form type is stored.
AND Clicking Save will store the new Form Type as it was entered by the user.
AND The Form Type will be available for use when creating new and editing existing system forms.

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=new_form_type

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89350246

title: As a Club user I want to be able to Request an Investigation for an International Amateur player
custom_preconds: GIVEN club user is logged in with Edit permissions for Investigations
custom_steps: WHEN user opens International Amateur player profile in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN Users with Edit permissions for Investigations see a Create New icon on International Amateur profiles.
AND Club users are able to launch a new Investigation Request for the player via the Create New. 
AND The Investigation Request workflow is able to be completed for the new kind of International Amateur profiles, just like it was previously. 
AND This needs to still work for existing international amateurs.

title: As a user I want updating an international amateur profile with an investigation to send the update to LARI
custom_preconds: GIVEN an International Player Profile has already been sent to LARI
custom_steps: WHEN the International Player Profile associated with a player ID a that has already been sent to LARI is updated
custom_expected:
THEN the information should be communicated to LARI 
AND saving changes to an International amateur profile that has an investigation associated with it should send those updates to LARI.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a NES List transaction for an international amateur player
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Edit permissions for MN Transactions
custom_steps: WHEN user opens International amateur player profiles
custom_expected:
THEN Users with Edit permissions for MN Transactions see a Create New icon on International Amateur profiles.
AND BOC users are able to launch a new Place on NES List for the player via the Create New. 
AND The Place on NES List transaction should work for the new version of international amateurs just as it does for the old version.

title: As a user I want Terms Accepting the MNC of an International Amateur player to convert the player into a professional player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with edit permissions for MNC
AND user is viewing MNC of an International Amateur player 
AND the MNC status is in Terms Submitted
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Update Status" from Terms Submitted to Terms Accepted
custom_expected:
THEN the international player profile should be converted to a Professional profile. 
AND All of the relevant information should be carried forward from the amateur to the professional profile.
AND The MLB Program Participation and other portions of the "International" tab should be appropriately populated, in addition to the Info tab. 
AND The player should no longer be visible in International Amateur searches and widgets. 
AND This needs to still work for existing international amateurs.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a MJ Contract for an International Amateur player
custom_preconds: GIVEN user logs in with MJC Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN Users with Edit permissions for MJ Contracts see a Create New icon on International Amateur profiles.
AND Users are able to launch a new MJ Contract for the player via the Create New. 
AND The MJ Contract should work for the new version of international amateurs just as it does for the old version, including the conversion to a professional player profile at the appropriate point.

title: As a BOC user I want to merge 2 Profiles
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN If they choose to click "Cancel" then the modal closes and no merge is taken. The user is returned to the Registration Admin with no changes saved. A
AND If they click "Merge" then the system will merge the two selected profiles. 
AND The Bio Information selected as the "Master" will now be the record for ANY user that loads that profile in the system. 
AND The system will need to maintain a record of the merge, and maintain BOTH player IDs. 
AND The attached files selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND The contact information selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND Any Origins that were available on BOTH profiles are also available to the BOC under the "Origin" dropdown.  (Ex: If Player 1 had Origins of BOC and MLSB, and Player 2 had Origins of BOC and BOS, the profile after the merge will have Master, BOC - 1, BOC- 2, MLSB and BOS)
AND The player will only appear once in the Reg Admin widget, Club Reg List and any searches using the new "Master" Bio information.
AND Clubs continue to see ONLY their own Contact information and Attached Files. 

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=player_merge

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Merging+Players+subject+to+Registration

*Additional merge rules covered in followup stories*
*NOTE TO QA: players can be merged multiple times - all of these merge stories will need to be tested accordingly.*

title: As a BOC user I want merging two international player profiles to bring over any relevant Investigation info
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget 
AND user has selected two player from the Red Admin widget using the check box
AND user has selected which Master records to keep
custom_steps: When user click "Merge"
custom_expected:
THEN the system should check to see if either of the players has an Investigation or Investigation Request associated with them. 
AND Regardless of which profile is selected as the "Master", all available Investigations and Investigation Requests need to be maintained and available via the newly merged profile. 
AND All relevant updates to player information and/or Player ID should also be sent to LARI per #139253907.

title: As a developer i want to be able to get Player ids that were updated (via a data fix)  - intl
custom_preconds: GIVEN one or more fields on an international amateur profile have been data fixed by devs
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the Ebis Link Updated Batch
custom_expected:
THEN player IDs for all profiles that were data fixed should display in batch results

*Note that this will need to work with existing international amateur players AND the "new" version after August*

title: As a Club user I want to see a detailed error message around any formatting errors contained in my spreadsheet
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Club user logs in with international player edit permissions
AND user clicks on "Spreadsheet Upload" on the Club Reg List widget
custom_steps: WHEN club user clicks on "Upload" on the modal
custom_expected:
THEN system will check that each row that contains data in the attached spreadsheet fulfills all of the required fields in order to process the spreadsheet. 
AND the system will also verify that DOBs entered follow the accepted format, and that each of the countries included can be found in the app. 
AND the system will return an error message with the number of rows that could not be processed, along with detailed information about which column requires attention in each of the rows. 
AND the system will not process any of the rows until the entire spreadsheet can pass this initial check.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=spreadsheet_upload

Template: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Spreadsheet+Upload+%28Registration%29-+Data+Discovery

title: As a BOC user I want to receive a "daily digest" email of Investigation results requested
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is on the Email Utility to receive a "daily digest" email of Investigation results requested
custom_steps: WHEN Club user requests Investigation Results for a player
custom_expected:
THEN At the end of each day, the system should check to see if any new Investigation Results requests were entered that day.
AND If no, then no email is generated.
OR If yes, then an email should be generated to those users that are in the Utility under "Investigation Results Requests" as meant to receive the email. 
AND The email should have the subject "mm/dd/yyyy Investigation Results Requests"
AND The email body should contain a "NEW REQUESTS:" header followed by a bulleted list of all of the requests entered into the system for the day, regardless of current status. The list should be formatted as Requesting Org - First Middle Last Extended Last. Ex: ARI - John David Jones Smith
AND Sort of the bulleted list should be on ORG and then on Player name.

title: As an LRD user I want to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_preconds: GIVEN LRD user is on the Email Utility to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_steps: WHEN Club user requests L2 Drug Test Results for a player
custom_expected:
THEN At the end of each day, the system should check to see if any new L2 Drug Test Results requests were entered that day.
AND If no, then no email is generated.
OR If yes, then an email should be generated to those users that are in the Utility under "L2 Drug Test Results" as meant to receive the email. 
AND The email should have the subject "mm/dd/yyyy L2 Drug Test Results Requests"
AND The email body should contain a "NEW REQUESTS:" header followed by a bulleted list of all of the requests entered into the system for the day, regardless of current status. The list should be formatted as Requesting Org - First Middle Last Extended Last. Ex: ARI - John David Jones Smith
AND Sort of the bulleted list should be on ORG and then on Player name.

title: As a BOC user I want to see Investigation Results populated on the L2 Investigation Results Request widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with L2 Investigation Results Request widget permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "L2 Inquiries" tab under International
custom_expected:
THEN Users with permission to see the L2 Investigation Results Request widget see the Age and Identity columns populated with the values from the player's Registration Investigation's "Final Age Result" and "Final Identity Result" fields. 
AND Each player should only have one Registration Investigation (Investigation with a type of "Registration") associated with them, but in the unlikely event there are two, look to the one with the latest create date. 
AND If the player does not have any Registration investigations, but has another type, use the Investigation with the latest create date.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete a grandfathered player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC logs in with Grandfathered profile delete permissions
AND User has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Grandfathered profile in edit or view mode
custom_expected:
THEN There is a "delete" button when viewing a grandfathered player profile in edit mode or view mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" prompts the user to confirm they wish to delete the profile. See Messages #10
AND Confirming on that message will prompt the user to be extra sure. See Messages # 11.
AND If the user confirms both messages, the player is deleted from the system. They should no longer appear on any widgets or in any searches and reports.

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to be able to run the International Registration Admin Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user logs
custom_steps: WHEN user is in reporting widget
custom_expected:
THEN "International Registration Admin Report" report will be in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND The category of this report should be "International". 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
AND The report will continue to use the existing LDAP. 
AND This is a BOC only report.

Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Reg+Admin+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Reg+Admin+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347945

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Reg+Admin+-+Report+Prompts

Report Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Reg+Admin+-+Security+-+Frequency

title: As a Scouting user I want to view an International Amateur profile
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=bureau
GIVEN a new LDAP has been created that allows users to Create/Edit Unregistered player profiles
AND a scouting user has logged in in that has this new LDAP and does NOT have EBIS-INTL-PLAYER-EDITORS or EBIS-INTL-PLAYER-VIEWERS
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with international amateur profiles
custom_expected:
THEN Opening an existing Unregistered profile should display per the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND opening an existing Registration profile should display per the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND these user should see "Scout" entered contact info
BUT these users should NOT see BOC or Club entered contact info
AND opening and existing Grandfathered profile should display the same as if the user were a club or regular BOC user
BUT if the user has BOTH the new permission AND one of the above LDAPs, then loading existing profiles will be treated as though the user is a regular registration user
AND the new LDAP mentioned should be added to test_ebis_user73@mlb.com - test_ebis_user77@mlb.com created in #157499039. (78 purposely left off)
*Note that in the data discovery the 'unregistered user' is called an MLSB user/profile*

title: As a scouting user I want the system to calculate a player's OFP and Group on an International Prospect or Signable Report
custom_preconds:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Scouting+Calculations
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to create an International Prospect or International Signable Report
custom_steps: WHEN user enters grades on the report for a player
custom_expected:
THEN system should calculate the Overall Future Potential (OFP) Basic and the Group number displayed on the International Workout report on the fly (as the user enters grades) per the provided calculations. 
AND the calculation should be different depending on if the report is for a position player or a pitcher
AND calculations should work as detailed below:
 A) Pitchers:

Total of Fastball Future, Curveball Future, Slider Future, and Other Future is multiplied by 10 and then divided by the total of non-zero values entered.

B) Position Players:

Total of Hitting Future, Power Future, Arm Strength Future and Fielding Future is multiplied by 2.

If OFP adjusted is not within 3 points of OFP Basic then comments are required explaining the reason for the difference

Group # is directly related to adjusted OFP and is subject to the following ranges:

Group 1 – 56 through 80
Group 2 – 50 through 55
Group 3 – 46 through 49
Group 4 – 41 through 45
Group 5 – less than 40

title: New Scouting User IDs
custom_preconds:
GIVEN four new test users have been set up four intl scouting
AND user is logged with permission to access user accounts page under utilities
custom_steps: WHEN user views any of the accounts listed below on the user accounts page
custom_expected:
THEN test_ebis_user73@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the new intl-user LDAP. (Scout)
AND test_ebis_user74@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the new intl-user LDAP. (Scout Admin)
AND test_ebis_user77@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the new intl-user LDAP. (Scout Viewer)
AND test_ebis_user75@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the International Reg Admin role and the new intl-user. (BOC Admin and Scout Admin)
AND test_ebis_user76@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the International Reg Admin role, and the new intl-user. (BOC Admin and Scout)
AND test_ebis_user78@mlb.com should have: Org of BOC, Pro Player Viewer role, as well as the EBIS-INTL-PLAYER-VIEWERS permission, and the new intl-user. (BOC Viewer and Scout Viewer)

title: Scout Clipboard - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN the EBIS-WIDGET-SCOUT-CLIPBOARD-VIEWERS permission AND the new intl-user LDAP(EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW) have been added to test accounts (test_ebis_user73@mlb.com and test_ebis_user76@mlb.com)
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in with one of these accounts
custom_expected:
THEN the Scout Clipboard widget should be visible for these users 
BUT users that do not have BOTH of these 2 permissions should not see the Scout Clipboard

title: Scout Admin Clipboard - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN the EBIS-WIDGET-SCOUTING-ADMIN-CLIPBOARD-VIEWERS permission AND the new intl-user LDAP(EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW) have been added to test accounts (test_ebis_user74@mlb.com and test_ebis_user75@mlb.com)
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in with one of these accounts
custom_expected:
THEN the scout admin Clipboard widget should be visible for these users 
BUT users that do not have BOTH of these 2 permissions should not see the scout admin clipboard
